title: Competency Enhancement Program for Evaluating Higher Education Instructional Design in Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design principles and online learning tool usage experience
context.additional_context: Focus on acquiring methods to evaluate blended learning design elements (goals, content, activities, resources, assessments) in smartphone-based LMS environments

learning_goals: Develop the ability to systematically analyze the five core elements of instructional design (goals, content, activities, resources, assessment) in blended learning environments

Using a Likert-scale tool (5-point scale), learners can measure ≥8 of 10 instructional design quality items with ≥80% reliability (Cronbach’s α) and interpret descriptive statistics (mean, standard deviation) via SPSS.

In large-scale vocational training (≥50 learners), learners select 3 mobile-accessible assessment strategies (quizzes, real-time polls, collaborative tasks) via smartphones/tablets, implement them on an LMS, and ensure ≥80% of learners complete the first attempt smoothly. Each strategy must meet technical stability (no lag), usability (intuitive UI), and validity (alignment with learning objectives).

Completing ≥3 project-based assessments in a 6-month course, learners propose ≥2 actionable instructional design improvements applicable to real vocational settings (e.g., industrial field training, mock lesson design) and achieve an average ≥4 points in expert panel evaluations (5-point scale).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
